channel.title: Help at the end of port forwarding
channel.description:
im done port forwarding but on the tut it has this also and i dont understand what to do on it please help?
[quote="adamator5"]Step 4:Next go to the very bottom left of your screen and right click the little 2 or 1 computers and click [code]Change Windows Firewall Settings[/code] Click Exceptions And Then Click [code]Add Port[/code] Name: [code]rsps[/code] and keep the TCP as TCP And Then Save it.[/quote]

item.title: Help at the end of port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Anc13nt_Arr0w Anc13nt Arr0w
item.description:
@Anc13nt_Arr0w wrote:

Make sure you have got the write make of modem, or if your wireless try and find the main modem, and look underneaf on the silver sticker.

Find the code on it and match it to the one on www.portfoward.com.

After that you have to open up your settings and find all these IP, and submask id’s.

Its tricky so watch out

Regards from Anc13nt Arr0w

Read full topic
item.source: Help at the end of port forwarding

item.title: Help at the end of port forwarding

@trevor268 wrote:

item.title: Help at the end of port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Incognito Incognito
item.description:
@Incognito wrote:

When you go there, there should be something asking if you want TCP or UCP. Simply, just use it as TCP.

If this type of port forwarding doesn’t work, you’ll have to do it the much harder way. I had to do it the harder way.

Read full topic
item.source: Help at the end of port forwarding

item.title: Help at the end of port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @trevor268 trevor268
item.description:
@trevor268 wrote:

im done port forwarding but on the tut it has this also and i dont understand what to do on it please help?

[quote=“adamator5”]Step 4:Next go to the very bottom left of your screen and right click the little 2 or 1 computers and click

Change Windows Firewall Settings

Click Exceptions
And Then Click

Add Port

Name:

rsps

and keep the TCP as TCP
And Then Save it.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Help at the end of port forwarding
